WPS, Wednus Positioning System

Detailed Description

It is the implementation of WPS, Wednus Positioning System.

This is the implementation of the idea of relating each window component in an organic manner so the windows can react (reposition/resize) by themselves for a certain event (i.e. resize) by calling each other recursively.

All the coordinate settings in the Wednus System follows this positioning system. As you see from the simplified web browser layout above, the vertical(v) range has three markers, 'left', 'xcenter' and 'right', and the horizontal(h) range also has three markers of 'top','ycenter' and 'bottom'. The left and up directions from v and h markers are negative and vice versa. Example coordinate data will help you understand:
  • the middle (of browser): 'xcenter:0,ycenter:0'
  • the 100(pixel)-left from the middle: 'xcenter:-100,ycenter:0'
  • the top-left corner: 'right:0,top:0'
  • the bottom-left: 'left:0,bottom:0'

See also:
http://wednus2.blogspot.com/2004/09/wps-wednus-positioning-system.html

Definition at line 43 of file wps.js.

W wednusify

Initial value:

 function(obj){
  var wobj = {};
  
  
  wobj.core = obj.core?obj.core:obj;
  
  wobj.body = obj.body?obj.body:document.createElement('div');
  
  wobj.wps = obj.wps?obj.wps:detect(obj);
  
  function detect(obj){
    var s = obj.style?obj.style:{};
    return parseInt(s.width?s.width:'100%')
      +','+ parseInt(s.height?s.height:'100%')
      +',left:0,top:0';
      
      
  };
  return wobj;
}
Wednusification.

If the parent is a WPS object, then it does establishing the hierarchy thing. It it is not, then it's gonna be just one time smart attachment.

W is_wednusified

Initial value:

 function(obj){
    return (typeof obj.body == 'object') && (typeof obj.core == 'object')
        && (typeof obj.wps == 'string');
}
Check obj.

Definition at line 79 of file wps.js.

W add

Append object to the WPS.

note: abs useful for relatively sizing/positioning independent objects warning: parent doesn't appendChild child. use 'Container' control for this purpose.

Parameters:
obj object to register to the parent
  • (object) child object to register (WPS object)
  • (array) array of children for batch addition
parent parent object
  • (object) parent object itself (WPS object)
  • (undefined) default: document.body
Returns:
original obj
Note:
parent doesn't need to be an WPS object

body appends core if it's possible

Warning:
it would be better to get WPS values by checking object properties rather than just set an initial value.

W repos

Implementation of WPS, Wednus Positioning System.

It recursively traverses child nodes and send repositioning signal.

Parameters:
parent parent object
